MANUAL: apt-matrix-diff (1.18.0)

apt-matrix-diff will check to see if two matrices contain the same values.

This can be annoying to do with a regular diff as differences in precision and outputting functions can lead to representational differences for two numbers that are the same (i.e. 1.0 == 1).

Quick Start

To compare tab-separated files file1.tab and file2.tab, use:

apt-matrix-diff -col-skip 1 -line-skip 1 file1.tab file2.tab

Options:

apt-matrix-diff - check to see if two matrices contain the same values.

This can be annoying to do with a regular diff as differences in 
precision and outputting functions can lead to representational 
differences for two numbers that are the same (i.e. 1.0 == 1).

usage:
   apt-matrix-diff -col-skip 1 -line-skip 1 file1.tab file2.tab

options:
   -h, --help                           This message. [default 'false'] 
   -m, --match-rows Try to match rows based on row names 
                          (useful for matrices in different orders).
                          [default 'false'] 
   -a, --allowed-mismatch Maximum number of non-matching numeric
                          values accepted. [default '0'] 
   -p, --print-mismatch Print out entries that don't match. 
                          [default 'false'] 
     --print-mismatch-max Maximum number of entries to that don't
                          match to report. [default '-1'] 
   -t, --text Compare files as straight text, without
                          conversion to numeric data. This behaves in
                          a fashion very similar to diff, except that
                          line-skip number of header lines and all
                          line ending differences are ignored.
                          [default 'false'] 
     --mixed Compare files as a mixture of numeric and
                          non-numeric data. If a field can be
                          converted to a floating point number,
                          compare numerically; if not, compare as
                          text. [default 'false'] 
   -l, --line-skip Number of lines (header?) to skip. [default
                          '0'] 
   -c, --col-skip Number of columns (row names?) to skip.
                          [default '0'] 
   -e, --epsilon Epsilon tolerance to differences. [default
                          '.001'] 
   -f, --fraction Fractional tolerance to differences.
                          [default '0.0'] 
     --version Display version information. [default
                          'false']
